metadata.title: CVE-2019-17669 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 5.2.4 has a Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF)vulnerability because URL validation does not consider the interpretationof a name as a series of hex characters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentythree - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentytwo - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.4+dfsg1-1').
